graphicslib3D

Class Shape3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Shape3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sphere, Torus

    public abstract class Shape3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Defines the abstract base class from which 3D shapes are derived. Every Shape3D contains attributes which include its name (a String), separate transformations for translation, rotation, and scaling (all Matrix3D's). Material, Texture, and shaderID removed 7/20/15 by Scott Gordon. OpenGL-specific drawing methods and enums removed 7/20/15 by Scott Gordon.
    Author:
    John Clevenger, William Dimaculangan, Monika Jankun-Kelly, Scott Gordon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape3D

        public Shape3D()
        Creates and initializes this Shape3D object. Initialization includes setting the shape name to the empty string, setting the translation, rotation, and scaling transformations associated with the shape to identity.

        Note that this constructor cannot be invoked directly since the class is abstract; it can only be invoked from a subclass.

      • Shape3D

        public Shape3D(java.lang.String name)
        Creates and initializes this Shape3D object. Initialization includes setting the shape name to the specified string.

        Note that this constructor cannot be invoked directly since the class is abstract; it can only be invoked from a subclass.

        Parameters:
        name - A String giving the name to be assigned to the shape.

        Note that this constructor cannot be invoked directly since the class is abstract; it can only be invoked from a subclass.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns a String containing the name of this Shape3D object. The default name string for objects is the empty string; it is the responsibility of the code which constructs the Shape3D (by instantiating a subclass) to set the object name. Setting the name can either be done from the subclass constructor via a superclass constructor call, or by using the setName() method.
        Returns:
        A String giving the shape's name.

      • getTranslation

        public Matrix3D getTranslation()
        Get the translation Matrix3D associated with this object.
        Returns:
        A reference to the Matrix3D which is this Shape3D's current translation matrix.

      • getRotation

        public Matrix3D getRotation()
        Get the rotation Matrix3D associated with this object.
        Returns:
        A reference to the Matrix3D which is this Shape3D's current rotation matrix.

      • getScale

        public Matrix3D getScale()
        Get the scaling Matrix3D associated with this object.
        Returns:
        A reference to the Matrix3D which is this Shape3D's current scale matrix.

      • getTransform

        public Matrix3D getTransform()
        Returns a single Matrix3D which contains the concatenation of the current translation, rotation, and scaling transforms of this Shape3D, with the concatenation done in that order (translation, then rotation, then scaling). Calling this method is equivalent to calling getTranslation(), getRotation(), and getScale() and then concatenating the returned Matrix3Ds together. Note that the effect of the concatenation order is such that if the returned Matrix3D is used as a composite transform, the order of application of the transforms of this Shape3D will be scaling first, then rotation, then translation last.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the specified string as the name of this Shape3D object.
        Parameters:
        name - A String giving the name to be assigned to the shape.

      • setTranslation

        public void setTranslation(Matrix3D mat)
        Set the translation matrix for this Shape3D. The shape's translation matrix is set to a clone (copy) of the specified Matrix3D.
        Parameters:
        mat - A Matrix3D specifying the values to which this shape's translation should be set.

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(Matrix3D mat)
        Set the rotation matrix for this Shape3D. The shape's rotation matrix is set to a clone (copy) of the specified Matrix3D.
        Parameters:
        mat - A Matrix3D specifying the values to which this shape's rotation should be set.

      • setScale

        public void setScale(Matrix3D mat)
        Set the scaling matrix for this Shape3D. The shape's scaling matrix is set to a clone (copy) of the specified Matrix3D.
        Parameters:
        mat - A Matrix3D specifying the values to which this shape's scale should be set.

      • translate

        public void translate(double tx,
                      double ty,
                      double tz)
        Concatenates a translation of amounts tx, ty, and tz in the X, Y, and Z directions respectively onto the translation matrix for this shape. Calling this method is equivalent to calling getTranslation().translate(tx,ty,tz).
        Parameters:
        tx - The translation amount in the X direction
        ty - The translation amount in the Y direction
        tz - The translation amount in the Z direction

      • scale

        public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy,
                  double sz)
        Concatenates a scaling by amounts sx, sy, and sz in the X, Y, and Z directions respectively onto the scaling transformation matrix for this shape. Calling this method is equivalent to calling getScale().scale(sx,sy,sz).
        Parameters:
        sx - The scale amount in the X direction
        sy - The scale amount in the Y direction
        sz - The scale amount in the Z direction

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double xAngle,
                   double yAngle,
                   double zAngle)
        Concatenates onto this shape's rotation transformation matrix a rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes by the specified angles, which are assumed to be in degrees. The effect of calling this method is the same as calling getRotation().rotate(xAngle, yAngle, zAngle) ; that is, the specified rotations are put into the matrix such that they are effectively performed in the order Y, then X, then Z.
        Parameters:
        xAngle - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the X axis
        yAngle - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Y axis
        zAngle - The angle of rotation, in degrees, about the Z axis

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double angle,
                   Vector3D axis)
        Concatenates onto this shape's rotation transformation matrix a rotation of angle degrees about the specified axis. Calling this method is equivalent to calling getRotation().rotate(angle,axis).
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle of rotation in degrees.
        axis - The axis about which the rotation occurs.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a clone (copy) of this shape. It is the responsibility of subclasses which extend this class to override this method and insure that a complete "deep clone" of the object is returned. The procedure for doing this is that the overriding clone() method should first invoke super.clone() (that is, invoke this method), which returns an object of type "Object". The invoking (subclass) clone() method should then cast the returned Object to the subclass type, and then copy all fields from the original subclass object to the copy. Note that copying the subclass fields must include making a deep copy (clone) of any objects referenced by those fields.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        An Object which is a clone (copy) of this shape.
